title: Charity shop uses ‘decapitated baby’ for its Halloween display
text:
The charity says it has now removed the display following complaints (Picture: BNPS)

A charity shop has been slammed for its ‘tasteless’ Halloween display which features a mother and a decapitated baby.

The Red Cross shop in Bournemouth, shows a mother and baby figurine, bearing a resemblance to Mary and a baby Jesus, with the baby’s head removed and fake blood pouring from the body.

Next to it is a glass bottle which reads: ‘Human blood.’

Locals were left unimpressed with some taking to social media to express their disgust, the Daily Echo reported.

One user wrote: ‘I can’t believe that a Red Cross shop in Southbourne, Bournemouth has this in display. Absolutely tragic and tasteless!’

A spokesperson for Red Cross said: ‘We apologise if anyone is offended by this display.’

Shoppers were horrified by the window exhibit at the Red Cross shop in Southbourne, Bournemouth (Picture: BNPS)

The charity added that it accepted the display fell short of ‘reasonable expectations’.

In a statement posted on Red Cross (Southbourne) Facebook page, the charity wrote: ‘On behalf of myself and all of my team members, we want to apologise for any of our Halloween window displays.

‘It was never our intention to offend anyone on that matter and all the window display have now been removed’.

description: The Red Cross shop in Bournemouth, shows a mother holding a baby figurine, with it's head removed and fake blood pouring from the body.
